25 questions/19 minutes

Each exam has a question of paralysis, if the candidate only needs to answer the wrong question, the score will be considered as a failure. The A1 driver\'s license exam consists of 25 questions to work on in 19 minutes.\n\nTo pass the test, candidates need to answer 21/25 questions correctly and not get any wrong points.

Class A1 driver\'s license exam consists of 25 questions to work on in 19 minutes.\n\nTo pass the test, you need to answer 21/25 questions correctly and not get any wrong points.
Class A1 driver\'s license exam consists of 25 questions to work on in 19 minutes.\n\nTo pass the test, you need to answer 21/25 questions correctly and not get any wrong points.

Acts of racing motor vehicles and special-use motorcycles that do not meet technical safety and environmental protection standards in road traffic are strictly prohibited.
Sentences 1 and 2 are wrong because both are illegal racing acts. Illegal racing is a prohibited act specified in the Road Traffic Law. \nThe correct answer is 3.
It is forbidden to operate a road vehicle with narcotics in the body.
Pursuant to Decree 100/2019/ND-CP stipulating penalties when participating in traffic with alcohol concentration, choose answer 1.
Pursuant to Decree 100/2019/ND-CP stipulating penalties when participating in traffic with alcohol concentration, choose answer 1.
Pursuant to Decree 100/2019/ND-CP stipulating penalties when participating in traffic with alcohol concentration, choose answer 2

Decree 100/2019, applied January 1, 2020, vehicle drivers participating in traffic of cars, motorbikes, and beautiful cars with alcohol content in their breath are strictly prohibited. Answer 1 is correct.
The act of handing over motor vehicles or special-use motorbikes to people who are not qualified to drive vehicles in traffic is not allowed. Answer 2 is correct.
Acts of operating a motor vehicle exceeding the prescribed speed, taking the road, or recklessly overtaking are strictly prohibited. Answer 3 is correct.
When driving on the road, the driver needs to observe and ensure that the vehicle speed does not exceed the allowed speed. Answer 3 is correct.
Road vehicles traveling at a slower speed must go to the right side of the road. Vehicles traveling at high speed should go on the left side of the road. Answer 2 is correct.
Road vehicles traveling at a lower speed must move to the right side of the road. Vehicles traveling at high speed should go on the left side of the road. Answer 1 is correct.

The act of passing a vehicle without fully observing the safety rules is strictly prohibited. Attempting to pass without observing the safety rules on distance… can easily cause traffic accidents. Answer 3 is correct.
Self-installation, use of horns and lights not in accordance with the manufacturer\'s design for each type of motor vehicle is not allowed. Answer 2 is correct.
How is the production, sale, and use of license plates for motor vehicles and special-use motorcycles regulated in the Law on Road Traffic?

On the narrow bridge there is one lane; where the road intersects, the road intersects at the same level as the railway + weather or road conditions are not safe for overtaking; Priority vehicles that are sending priority signals on duty are not safe to overtake. Answer 1 is correct. Answers 2,3 are overtaken because there are 2 lanes or more.
Not allowed, answer 2.

Answer 2 is incorrect because at the crosswalk, on the bridge, at the bridgehead, on the highway, on the narrow road, on the ramp, at the place where the road intersects at the same level with the railway, the driver is not allowed to turn head. Answer 1 is correct.
Answers 1 and 3 are wrong because it is forbidden to stop and park at the same time in any case. Answer 2 is correct.
Drivers of two-wheeled, three-wheeled motorcycles and mopeds are prohibited from using the vehicle to pull or push other vehicles or objects when participating in traffic. Answer 4 is correct.

It is forbidden for drivers of two-wheelers, three-wheelers or mopeds to let go of both hands; using the vehicle to pull or push another vehicle or object; Use the vehicle\'s kickstand to wipe the road while the vehicle is running. Answer 3 is correct.

It is forbidden for drivers of two-wheelers, three-wheelers or mopeds to let go of both hands; using the vehicle to pull or push another vehicle or object; Use the vehicle\'s kickstand to wipe the road while the vehicle is running. Answer 1 is correct.
Drivers of two-wheelers, three-wheelers and mopeds are prohibited from carrying or carrying bulky objects while participating in traffic. Answer 2 is correct.

It is forbidden for people sitting on two-wheeled motorbikes, three-wheeled motorbikes or mopeds to join traffic when participating in traffic, not to cling to, pull or push other vehicles. Answer 4 is correct.

It is forbidden for people sitting on two-wheeled motorbikes, three-wheeled motorbikes and mopeds to use umbrellas when participating in traffic to avoid endangering themselves and other vehicles. Answer 3 is correct.
It is forbidden for people sitting on motorbikes to drag other vehicles. Answer 2 is correct.

Drivers of two-wheeled motorcycles, three-wheeled motorcycles and mopeds are prohibited from using the vehicle to pull or push other vehicles or objects when participating in traffic. Answer 3 is correct.
Drivers of two-wheelers, three-wheelers and mopeds are prohibited from carrying or carrying bulky objects while participating in traffic. Answer 1 is correct.

Order of priority:
- Signaling operator
- Traffic lights
- Signaling signs
- Road markings.
Answer 1 is correct.

It is forbidden to make U-turns at pedestrian crossings, on bridges, at bridgeheads, under overpasses, underground, in tunnels on footpaths, on highways, at intersections at the same level with railways, narrow roads, ramps, curve sections of visibility are obscured. Answer 1 is correct.
Rail transport is always the first priority. Answer 3 is correct.

Must give way to vehicles on the road. There must be a signal to get in and give way to vehicles running on the road. If there is an speeding lane, you must run in that lane first. Answer 1 is correct.

People sitting on motorbikes and mopeds are required to wear helmets and straps when participating in traffic. Every time you sit on the car, you must wear a helmet even if you are close. There are many tragic accidents that happen due to subjectively not wearing a helmet due to close proximity, just leaving the house, the accident, you guys be careful. Answer 1 is correct.

Drivers of two-wheeled motorbikes and mopeds are not allowed to ride in a horizontal line; ride on the roadway for pedestrians and other vehicles; use umbrellas, cell phones, audio devices (except hearing aids). Answer 2 is correct.

Sentence 1 is wrong because the curb is understood as the edge on both sides of the road. The roadside has the effect of protecting the road surface, this part of the road is usually for people. Not for traffic.
Question 3 is incorrect because the part of the road for motor vehicles is the part of the road used for road motor vehicles and special-use motorcycles
Question 2 is correct because the driveway is the portion of the roadway used for all vehicular traffic.
Tip: The curb is not intended for vehicular traffic.
A lane is a part of a longitudinally divided portion of the roadway, which is wide enough for a vehicle to run safely. Sentence 2 is correct.
Sentence 1 is incorrect because it is divided vertically but lacks enough width for the car to run safely

National technical regulation QCVN 41:2016/BGTVT on road signals, according to which, medians are of two types: fixed medians and movable medians.\nDair fixed medians are medians have a fixed position on the portion of the roadway.\nMovable medians are medians that can be moved along the width of the road surface. The correct answer is answer 1.
A driver is a person who controls motor vehicles such as motorbikes, cars…\nCorrect answer: 1

Answer 4. You are on the priority road, so you should be given way by traffic coming from other directions when crossing the intersection, with priority road signs posted\nTip: Priority roads are given way .

Motor vehicles include trailers or semi-trailers pulled by cars, tractors, electric motorcycles.\n Answer 1 is incorrect because there are special-use motorbikes. Specialized motorbikes are not means of road transport. Correct answer: 2.

The rudimentary means of transportation are vehicles that use human or animal power to move, without cars, tractors… Answers 2 and 3 are incorrect because there are cars, tractors, motorbikes.\nCorrect answers: 1
Vehicles participating in road traffic include road vehicles (motorized and rudimentary) and special-use motorbikes.\nCorrect answers: 3

A person in road traffic is a person who drives, uses a vehicle, leads an animal, or a pedestrian.\nNo matter who walks or uses any vehicle, just participating in road traffic is a road users.\nCorrect answer: 3.
The driver of a vehicle participating in traffic means a person operating any vehicle participating in road traffic (motor vehicles, rudimentary vehicles, special-use motorcycles). Correct answer: 3
The traffic controller is the person who guides, controls, divides the flow, etc. to help the traffic flow smoothly and safely. Answer 2 is correct.
To stop a vehicle is to stand still temporarily and for a necessary period of time. Correct answer: 2.
Parking is stationary and has no time limit. Correct answer: 2.
All of the above behaviors show a lack of culture when participating in traffic.\nCorrect answer: 4.
Tip: Have enough width for the vehicle to run safely.

Answers 2 and 3 are incorrect because the vehicle must be driven in the correct lane, not in any lane with few vehicles and it is mandatory to wear a helmet when participating in traffic on any route.\nAnswer correct: 1.
Answer 2 is wrong because the scene must be kept to ensure the best evidence collection process\nCorrect answer: 1

Answers 2 and 3 are wrong because the vehicle must be driven in the correct lane, not in any lane with few vehicles and must stop and park at the specified place, not to facilitate the delivery of passengers and goods. chemistry\nCorrect answer: 1
Always bring the front end of the vehicle to a dangerous place for better visibility. Answer 2 is wrong because \"putting the rear of the car in a dangerous direction\". The correct answer is: 1.
Answer 3 is wrong because avoiding each other at night must not open the headlights, dazzling the opposite person. Answer 4 is correct.
Must slow down and downshift. Answer 2 is wrong because it is accelerating and not in low gear. Correct answer: 1
Answer 3 is correct. Using only the front or rear brakes is an unsafe behavior that can easily cause a dangerous accident.
Answer 3 is correct. Using only the front or rear brakes is an unsafe behavior that can easily cause a dangerous accident.
To ensure safety, all of the above must be applied, correct answer: 4.

The throttle on a motorcycle does not have the effect of controlling the vehicle in reverse. To control the car moving forward, control the engine power from there so that we can go as fast and slow as we want. Answer 4 is correct.

The rearview mirror is used to safely see behind both the left and right sides before changing direction. Always remember to look in the rearview mirror before turning to ensure your safety. Answer 3 is correct.

Accelerate slowly to ensure you keep the speed of the motorcycle within your control. Reduce throttle quickly to ensure stopping when encountering obstacles or need to brake to ensure safety. Answer 3 is correct.

When traveling on rough and bumpy roads, if the driver sits still on the car to go as usual, the car bouncing due to the bumpy road can make the driver tired quickly and it is very difficult to control the vehicle. Answer 1 is correct.
Sign 1 "No motorcycles", no motorbikes are allowed\nSignal 2 "No cars" do not ban motorbikes (not motorbikes).\nBoth signs allow motorbikes to enter. Answer 3 is correct.

Sign 1 is forbidding 2-wheelers from entering.
Traffic signs 2 is forbidding cars.
Section 3 is forbidding tractors.
Correct answer: 1. (Sign 1)

Sign 1 is forbidden to enter two-wheelers.
Traffic signs 2 is forbidding cars.
Section 3 is forbidding tractors.
Answer 3 is correct: Traffic signs 2 and sign 3.
Sign 1 "No turning left" does not prohibit turning.\nSignal 2 "No turning left" is prohibited.\nAnswer 2 is correct: Sign 2.
Sign 1 "No turning left" does not prohibit turning.\nSignal 2 "No turning left" is prohibited.\nAnswer 1 is correct: Sign 1.
Sign 1 "No turning left" does not prohibit turning.\nSignal 2 "No turning left" is prohibited.\nAnswer 2 is correct: Sign 2.

Sign 1 "Do not turn right".
Sign 2 "Prohibit turning right and turning vehicles".
Signal 3 "Do not allow cars to turn right and turn around".
Answer 1 is correct: Signs 1 and 2. Note that this sentence will confusing

Sign 1 "No left turn is prohibited".
Signal 2 "No left turn or turn is prohibited".
Signal 3 "No left turn or turn is prohibited".
Answer 1 is correct: Signs 1 and 2.
Sign 1 "No left turn" does not prohibit turning.\nSignal 2 "Rounding area". Left turn is allowed, so this answer is correct.\nAnswer 2 is correct.
Sign 1 "No left turn" does not prohibit turning.\nSignal 2 "Rounding area". The sign of the turning area is a sign indicating the area where the vehicle is allowed to turn.\nAnswer 3 is correct.

Sign 1: 123a "No left turn" but no U-turn is prohibited. You should be allowed to make a U-turn.\nSignal 2. R.301e placed in front of the intersection can only turn left at the intersection, the intersection is behind the traffic signs surface, so you cannot make a U-turn.\nAnswer 1 is correct.

Sign 1: "Forbidden road".
Sign 2: "Prohibit going in the opposite direction".
Signal 3: "No parking".
Answer 2 is correct.

Sign 1: "Forbidden road".
Sign 2: "Prohibit going in the opposite direction".
Signal 3: "No parking".
Answer 3 is correct.

Sign 1: "Forbidden road" does not prohibit priority vehicles.
Sign 2: R.122 "Stop" applies to priority vehicles.
Signal 3: P.102 "Prohibit going in the opposite direction" does not apply to vehicles priority.
Answer 2 is correct.
Sign 1: "Forbidden road" does not prohibit priority vehicles.\nSign 2: R.122 "Stop" applies to priority vehicles.\nAnswer 1 is correct.

Sign 1 is banning 3-wheeled vehicles (motorcycles).
Section 2 prohibits 3-wheel motorized vehicles (motorcycles).
Section 3 prohibits 3-wheel vehicles without a motor.
Answer 4 is correct.

Sign 1 is banning 3-wheeled vehicles (motorcycles).
Section 2 prohibits 3-wheel motorized vehicles (motorcycles).
Section 3 prohibits 3-wheel vehicles without a motor.
Answer 3 is correct.
Speed signs darken when participating in traffic at night between 10pm and 5pm.\nAnswer 1 is correct.
Auxiliary traffic signs is a variable S.501 "Range of the variable" determines the length of the main traffic signs from the place where the sign is located.

The main traffic signs is "Forbidden Road", if there is a secondary sign, the ban will be applied according to the secondary sign. So traffic signs 1 and 3 do not apply to motorcycles is the correct answer.

Answer: 2.
Explanation: In order:
1.No vehicles enter the intersection.
2. No priority vehicle.
3. Following the priority road: Trucks and motorbikes located on the priority road should go first. In which, trucks going straight should go first, the rest are motorbikes. Similarly: the auto rickshaw and the passenger car are on the same road without priority, however, the auto-rickshaw goes straight ahead, and the car turns left to go last.

Answer: 3.
Explanation: In order:
1.No vehicles have entered the intersection
2.No priority vehicles.
3.No priority road signs.
4.So the vehicles At the same level: The car on the right is empty, so the motorbike goes first, after the motorbike has gone, the car on the right is empty, so the motorbike goes next, and finally the truck.
Answer: 2.\nExplanation: motorcycles encounter the STOP sign, so they stop to give way.

Answer: 1.
Explanation: In order
1.The auto-rickshaw has entered the intersection, so it should go first.
2.Ambulance is the priority vehicle, so it should go next.
3.Finally, the passenger car
Answer: 2.\nExplanation: the ambulance is the priority vehicle and should go first.
Answer: 1.\nExplain: cars and buses with green lights should be allowed to go.
Answer: 3.\nExplanation: cars and trucks with green lights should be allowed to go.
Answer: 1.\nExplanation: The bus went in the wrong direction (it should have turned left). Truck runs red light. Motorcycle going in the wrong direction (should have turned left)

Answer: 3.\nExplanation: At the intersection of the same level, there is no sign to follow the roundabout, give way to the vehicle on the right. The right side of the motorcycle does not get in the way of other vehicles, so there is no need to yield. Motorcycle ahead. After the motorcycle has gone, the truck on the right will not get in the way, so it will continue. Stay like that until the end.
Answer: 1.\nExplanation: Observe the auxiliary sign below the stop and park prohibition sign, it is a picture of a truck. Meaning: it is forbidden for trucks to stop and park here.
Answer: 2.\Explanation: cars located on the priority road should go first.
Answer: 1.\Note: Direction No. 2 prohibits motorbikes, so motorbikes can enter.
Answer: 1.\nExplanation: The auxiliary sign placed under the no stopping and parking sign means: It is forbidden to stop and park in front of and behind this sign.
Answer: 3.\nExplanation: The truck is parked in the opposite direction. Motorcycles parked on the pedestrian crossing. Car ran over the stop line.
Answer: 2.\nExplanation: There are signs prohibiting cars from pulling trailers. Besides, according to regulations, cars are not allowed to pull motorbikes.
Answer: 2.
Answer: 4.\nExplanation: Vehicles of the same level, the car on the right is empty, go first.
Answer: 1.

Being the understanding and strict observance of traffic laws; sense of responsibility to the community when participating in traffic.
Is a cultured behavior, with love for people in unfortunate situations when participating in traffic.
Both points 1 and 2.
Control the vehicle to go on the right in the direction you go; go in the right part of the road and lane; Wear a standard helmet, properly fastened the straps.
Driving the vehicle on the part of the road or lane with few vehicles participating in traffic
Wear a helmet where there are signs that require helmets
Control the vehicle to go on the right in the direction you go; go in the right part of the road and lane; stop and park the vehicle at the specified place; If you\'ve been drinking, don\'t drive.
Driving the vehicle on the part of the road or lane with little traffic; stopping or parking at a convenient place or at the request of passengers or relatives.
Stop and park the vehicle at a convenient place for the delivery of passengers and goods; If you use less alcohol, you can drive.
Perform first aid in an emergency; Report the accident to law enforcement.
Quickly drive the accident vehicle or hitchhike away from the scene of the accident.
Both points 1 and 2.
Continuously honk the horn to urge the vehicles ahead to give way.
Walk up the sidewalk, make use of every space to quickly get out of the traffic jam.
Cross into the left lane and try to overtake another vehicle.
All of the above comments.

When driving a motorcycle, what should the driver do to ensure safety?

Watch for signs to see where turning is allowed; carefully observe the terrain where you choose to turn; select the appropriate turning trajectory; turning the vehicle at a low speed; regularly signal to people; If you make a U-turn in a dangerous place, turn the front of the vehicle to the dangerous direction and bring the rear of the vehicle to the safe direction.

Watch for signs to see where turning is allowed; carefully observe the terrain where you choose to turn; selection of the vehicle\'s turning trajectory; turning the vehicle at full speed; regularly signal to people and vehicles around to know; If turning the vehicle in a dangerous place, turn the rear of the vehicle to the dangerous side and the front of the vehicle to the safe side.
Do not try to enter the narrow road; vehicles going on the side of the mountain should stop first to give way; When stopping to give way, you must park neatly.
While avoiding each other should not change numbers; When avoiding each other at night, turn off the headlights and turn on the low beams.
When avoiding each other at night, you must regularly turn on the headlights and turn off the low beams.
Both point 1 and point 2.
Carefully observe obstacles and signal with horns and lights; Reduce the speed to the required level, downshift, and perform a turn at a speed that matches the radius of curvature of the roundabout.
Carefully observe obstacles and signal with horns and lights; Accelerate to quickly cross the detour and slow down after the detour.
Use the front brake
Use the rear brake.
Reduce gas completely; Use both rear and front brakes at the same time.
Use whistle.
Braking both front and rear brakes at the same time.
Use only the front brake or only the rear brake.
Turn on your turn signal before turning, and slowly slow down to a stop.
Make a U-turn only at places where you are allowed to make a U-turn.
Safely observe vehicles coming from the front, rear, and sides, and at the same time give way to vehicles coming from the right and in front.
All of the above ideas
To control the car to move forward.
To regulate engine power thereby controlling vehicle speed.
To control the vehicle in reverse.
Both point 1 and point 2.
To safely observe the left side when preparing to turn left.
To safely observe the right side when preparing to turn right.
To safely look behind both the left and right side before turning.
To safely look ahead both left and right before turning.
Accelerate quickly, reduce throttle slowly.
Accelerate quickly, decelerate quickly.
Accelerate slowly, decelerate quickly.
Increase throttle slowly, reduce throttle slowly.
Stand up straight on the handlebars then bend your knees and elbows slightly, walking slowly so you don\'t bounce too hard.
Sit back, accelerate to pass quickly through the bumpy road.
Sit sideways to the left or right to balance through the bumpy road.

Drivers of motorcycles, cars, or tractors on the road with alcohol in their blood or breath: Prohibited

– 35m if circulating speed(V) = 60(km/h)
- 55m if V:60 - 80
- 70m if V:80 - 100
- 100m if V: 100 - 120
- Below 60km/h: Be proactive and ensure the distance.
- Motorcycle: 16 years old (under 50 cm3)\n- Motorcycle + B1 + B2: 18 years old

- Do not turn, do not reverse, do not overtake
- Do not cross a narrow bridge with only one lane.
- No U-turn is allowed in the pedestrian crossing.

- There is a roundabout: Yield to the left\n- There is no roundabout to give way to the right
Prohibit cars (Including: 3-wheel motorcycles, Lam cars, passenger cars) -> Prohibit trucks -> Prohibit tractors -> Prohibit trailers, semi-trailers

- First place: the car that gets to the line first will go first.\n- Second place: the priority vehicle gets to go first. Order of priority vehicles: Fire-Suffering-Injury (Fire - Military - Police - Ambulance - Dike protection - Convoy of hearses).\n- Three roads: vehicles on main road, priority road.\ n- Four directions: order of direction: empty right - turn right - go straight - turn left.

- Fire: Fire truck
- Incident: Military vehicle
- Security: Police vehicle
- Injury: Ambulance
- Dike protection vehicle, vehicle for emergency duty
- Convoy of hearses
- A1 motorcycles under 175 cm3 and 3-wheeled vehicles of the disabled\n- A2 motorcycles 175 cm3 or more

- Danger sign (yellow triangle)
- Forbidden sign (red circle)
- Command sign (blue circle)
- Directional sign (blue square or rectangle)
- Additional sign (square, black and white rectangle): The effect is on the auxiliary sign when there is an auxiliary sign
- 60km/h: For double or one-way roads with 2 or more motor vehicle lanes\n- 50km/h: For 2-way or 1-way roads with 1 motor vehicle lane

- Special-use motorcycles, mopeds (including electric motorcycles) and similar vehicles on roads (except highways): 40km/h\n- Motor vehicles and special-use motorbikes on highways must comply with the maximum speed, the minimum speed and not exceed: 120km/h
- Increase 1 decrease 2 (decrease the number of choices with the word throttle)
- Including road motorized vehicles and rudimentary road vehicles.
Including road vehicles and special-use motorbikes
Including construction motorcycles, agricultural and forestry motorcycles and other special vehicles used for national defense and security purposes and participating in road traffic.

- Raise your hand vertically: All stop, except for vehicles already in the intersection where you are allowed to go\n- Cross your arms: Left and right; front and back stop\n- Right hand raised first: After, right stop, first turn right, left go in all directions, pedestrians cross the road behind the operator.

- Do not drive continuously for more than 4 hours.
- Do not work for more than 10 hours a day for a driver.
- Transport dealers are not allowed to change their pick-up and drop-off locations on their own.
- Transport Dangerous goods must be licensed.
- Motorcycles going down a long slope need to use both the front and rear brakes to slow down.\n- Make a low speed turn.

- Order of priority without roundabout: Vehicles enter the fork, first intersection - priority vehicle - priority road - road of the same level in the order of empty right - turn right - go straight - turn left.\n- Intersection Roundabouts of the same level: If you have not entered the roundabout, the right vehicle shall be given priority; has entered the roundabout to give priority to vehicles coming from the left.\n- Vehicles going downhill must give way to vehicles going uphill
